title: Gauss law - compare E at R at R-over-3 and at 3R

content.question: An insulating sphere of radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> has a charge <math alttext="uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math> uniformly distributed throughout its volume. Which of the following correctly ranks the electric field magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> at distances of <math alttext="uppercase R over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>, and <math alttext="3 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></math> from the center of the sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="E sub uppercase R over 3, end sub, equals E sub uppercase R, which is greater than E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="E sub uppercase R over 3, end sub, is greater than E sub uppercase R, which is greater than, E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="E sub uppercase R, is greater than E sub uppercase R over 3, end sub, which equals E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

<math alttext="E sub uppercase R, is greater than E sub uppercase R over 3, end sub, which is greater than E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="E sub uppercase R, is greater than E sub uppercase R over 3, end sub, which is greater than E sub 3 uppercase R, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mi>R</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mi>R</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>E</mi><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
